answer: Based on the latest available data, President Donald Trump delivered a speech after his inaugural address on January 19, 2025. In this speech, Trump praised his plans and referred to his first speech as relatively restrained. He also mentioned that his advisers did not want him to discuss his intentions to pardon his supporters who rioted at the Capitol on January 6, 2021, but indicated he would follow through on his promises. Trump characterized this second speech as better than the one he delivered upstairs. Additionally, Trump's inaugural address themes included "unity, strength, and fairness," and he called for a "revolution of common sense."

results.title: Trump Rambles About His Enemies In More On-Brand Speech After His Inaugural Address - HuffPost
results.content: Trump Rambles About His Enemies In Speech After His Inaugural Address | HuffPost Latest News WASHINGTON — After delivering a relatively restrained inaugural address in the U.S. Capitol rotunda Monday, President Donald Trump went downstairs to the Capitol Visitor Center and delivered a much more typical speech insulting his enemies and meandering from topic to topic. Trump said his advisers didn’t want him to talk about his plans to pardon his supporters who rioted at the Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021, but suggested he would soon follow through on his many pledges to pardon them for their crimes that day. “And I think this a better speech than the one I made upstairs,” Trump said after he was more than half an hour into his second set of remarks.

results.title: Trump inauguration live updates: Will call for 'revolution of common sense' in speech - ABC News
results.content: Trump inauguration live updates: Will call for 'revolution of common sense' in speech - ABC News Trump inauguration live updates: Will call for 'revolution of common sense' in speech President-elect Donald Trump attends a wreath laying ceremony at Arlington National Cemetery ahead of the presidential inauguration in Arlington, Va., Jan. 19, 2025. Trump has told ABC's Rachel Scott the themes of his inaugural address with be "unity, strength and fairness." He will call for a "revolution of common sense," according to excerpts of his speech. Separately, top Trump officials told ABC News he is preparing to take more than 200 executive actions on his first day in office. President-elect Donald Trump and Vice President-elect JD Vance attend a wreath laying ceremony at Arlington National Cemetery ahead of the presidential inauguration in Arlington, Va., Jan. 19, 2025.

results.title: Donald Trump Censored His Inaugural Speech. And Then He Said The Rest - TIME
results.content: Soon After Inauguration, Trump Delivered 2nd Uncensored Speech | TIME TIME 2030 “I think this was a better speech than the one I made upstairs,” Trump said as he circled for a much overdue closing. When Trump arrived in Washington eight years ago, he shocked the establishment with a speech now short-handed as “American Carnage.” This sequel was similar in its angry, bleak tone but amped up with little of the polish that some in Washington had hoped would signal Trump’s second term might be less spiteful than the first go-around. “From this moment on, America’s decline is over,” Trump said in the vetted speech as his predecessor looked on. And hello to the golden age of America,” Trump deputy chief of staff Stephen Miller said Sunday evening at that campaign rally. The American people have spoken,” Trump said in the Capitol Rotunda on Monday.
